channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Sterling Partner Engagement Manager
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Sterling Partner Engagement Manager

item.title: CVE-2022-34334|2024-08-03T09:07:16.125Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 2.0 does not invalidate session after logout which could allow an authenticated user to impersonate another user on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 229704.

item.title: CVE-2022-35640|2024-08-03T09:36:44.407Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.2.2 could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information when a detailed technical error message is returned. IBM X-Force ID: 230933.

item.title: CVE-2022-22332|2024-08-03T03:07:50.213Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.2.0 could allow an attacker to impersonate another user due to missing revocation mechanism for the JWT token. IBM X-Force ID: 219131.

item.title: CVE-2022-22360|2024-08-03T03:14:54.536Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2, and Cloud/SasS 22.2 could allow a remote authenticated attacker to conduct an LDAP injection. By using a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability and could result in in granting permission to unauthorized resources. IBM X-Force ID: 220782.

item.title: CVE-2022-22358|2024-08-03T03:14:54.687Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2, and Cloud/SasS 22.2 is vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 220651.

item.title: CVE-2022-35639|2024-08-03T09:36:44.385Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1, 6.2, and Cloud 22.2 do not limit the length of a connection which could cause the server to become unresponsive. IBM X-Force ID: 230932.

item.title: CVE-2022-34335|2024-08-03T09:07:16.086Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2.0, and 6.2.1 could allow an authenticated user to exhaust server resources which could lead to a denial of service. IBM X-Force ID: 229705.

item.title: CVE-2023-28517|2024-08-02T13:43:22.600Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2.0, and 6.2.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 250421.

item.title: CVE-2022-35640|2024-07-22T14:36:41.814Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.2.2 could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information when a detailed technical error message is returned. IBM X-Force ID: 230933.

item.title: CVE-2023-28517|2024-03-13T09:14:01.863Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2.0, and 6.2.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 250421.

item.title: CVE-2023-28517|2024-08-02T20:22:53.663Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2.0, and 6.2.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 250421.
